Forbes and Walker Tea Brokers
MOST COMPREHENSIVE WEBSITE ON TEA
www.forbestea.com
Page 2
Page 2
COMMENTS
A total of 6.3 M/Kgs were on offer this week. Low Grown/Leafy teas, in general, met with mixed demand, whilst the High & Mid Grown Small Leaf teas witnessed improved demand.
Ex-Estate offerings were marginally lower to last and totalled 0.76 M/Kgs vis-à-vis 0.8 M/Kgs on offer the previous week. Preferable quality and declining volumes perhaps triggered greater market activity and a dearer trend in prices.
Best Western BOP/BOPF's gained by up to Rs. 50 per kg, whilst the others were irregular following quality. In the Below Best category, improved BOP/BOPF's gained by Rs. 50 per kg and more for select invoices, whilst the others were firm and dearer to a lesser extent. At the lower end, BOP's were Rs. 20-40 per kg dearer with the cleaner sorts appreciating further. Corresponding BOPF's gained by Rs. 20-40 per kg, whilst the poorer sorts were firm and dearer to a lesser extent. Nuwara Eliyas' met with limited interest and a majority of the teas remained unsold. Uda Pussellawas' were weaker and barely steady. Uva BOP/BOPF's were generally firm.
CTC teas, in general, were firm to marginally easier.
Less activity from shippers to the UK, the continent and South Africa. Fair demand from shippers to Japan and China, whilst shippers to the CIS and Middle East continued to be active as usual.
Low Growns totalled approximately 2.6 M/Kgs. All categories met with fair demand.
In the Leafy and Semi-Leafy catalogues, well-made BOP1's appreciated, whilst the Below Best and bolder varieties remained firm. Teas at the bottom end were irregularly easier.  Well-made OP1's too were dearer, whilst the balance together with the teas at the bottom were irregular. Well-made OP's together with cleaner Below Best and shorter varieties gained, whilst the others were irregular following quality. High-priced OPA's appreciated, whilst the balance were firm. Select Best and Best PEKs' were firm, whilst the balance, including mixed/open varieties, were dearer. The teas at the bottom sold at last levels. PEK1's were generally fully firm.
In the Tippy catalogue, Select Best FBOP's were easier, whilst the Best varieties held firm. The balance were irregularly easier. FF1's were mostly lower.
In the Premium catalogue, very Tippy teas met with good demand and appreciated. The Best and Below Best types were firm, whilst the balance declined. However, the smaller varieties were easier.
FORBES & WALKER TEA BROKERS (PVT) LTD SALE OF - 15TH/ 16TH JULY 2025
Forbes and Walker Tea Brokers
MOST COMPREHENSIVE WEBSITE ON TEA
www.forbestea.com
Page 3
Page 3
MARKET
Improved demand
HIGH GROWN TEAS
BOP
Best Western's - Select invoices gained by up to Rs. 50 per kg, whilst the others were irregular. In the Below Best category, a selection of improved teas gained by Rs. 50 per kg and more following quality/special inquiry, whilst the others were firm and dearer to a lesser extent. Teas at the lower end of the market were firm and Rs. 20-40 per kg dearer, whilst the cleaner sorts appreciated further. Nuwara Eliya's were mostly unsold. Uda Pussellawa's were irregular and tended easier. Uva's - Better teas were firm, whilst the others were barely steady.
BOPF
Best Western's were firm and up to Rs. 50 per kg dearer following quality, whilst the others were irregular. In the Below Best category, a selection of improved teas gained by Rs. 50 per kg and more, whilst the others were firm and dearer to a lesser extent. Plainer clean leaf types were Rs. 20-40 per kg dearer, whilst the others were firm and dearer to a lesser extent. Nuwara Eliya's were mostly unsold. Uda Pussellawa's were irregular and easier. Uva's - Clean leaf coloury sorts were firm, whilst the others were irregular.
OP/OPA
Well-made varieties were dearer by Rs. 20-40 per kg, whilst the others and poorer sorts were firm to dearer by Rs. 20 per kg.
PEKOE/PEKOE1
Flavoury PEK's were firm to easier by Rs. 20 per kg. PEK1's were irregularly dearer by Rs. 40-60 per kg, whilst the Orthodox Leafy PEK's were easier by Rs. 20-40 per kg. Best PEK1's were firm to easier by Rs. 20 per kg. Best Rotovane PEK's gained considerably following quality/special inquiry, whilst the others were barely steady following quality. Below Best and poorer sorts sold at last levels.
FBOP/FBOPF1
Select Best flavoury FBOP/FBOPF1's met with poor demand and were mostly unsold, whilst the better Orthodox FBOP/FBOPF1's were substantially lower. Teas at the bottom end held firm.

OFF GRADES
FGS1/FGS
Teas in the Best category were firm to dearer. Improved Below Best varieties gained Rs. 20-40 per kg, whilst the others maintained. Teas at the lower end of the market were firm to easier. Low Growns - Best together with the Below Best varieties were firm, whilst the poorer sorts were irregularly easier. CTC - In general maintained at last week's levels
BROKENS
Reducer varieties in the Best category together with the clean leaf sorts gained by Rs. 20- 30 per kg, whilst the balance which commenced firm to easier by Rs. 10-20 per kg, declined by Rs. 30-40 per kg as the sale progressed.
BOP1A
Main Grade reducer varieties maintained, whilst select mixed types were slightly easier. Below Best sorts were firm, whilst select invoices were easier by Rs. 20 per kg. Poorer sorts maintained.

CROP AND WEATHER
For the period 08 - 15  July 2025
Western/Nuwara Eliya Regions
Both regions reported bright weather and occasional showers throughout the week. Rain is expected in the Western and Nuwara Eliya regions in the week ahead, according to the Department of Meteorology.
Uva/Uda Pussellawa Regions
Sunny weather was reported in both regions throughout the week. The Department of Meteorology expects showers in the Uva and Uda Pussellawa regions in the week ahead.
Low Growns
The Low Grown Region reported bright mornings and occasional evening showers  throughout the week. According to the Department of Meteorology, fairly heavy showers are expected in the Low Grown Region in the week ahead.
Crop Intake
The Western, Nuwara Eliya and Low Grown regions maintained the crop intake, whilst the Uva and Uda Pussellawa regions showed a decrease.

MOMBASA AUCTION
SALE OF - 14TH AND 15TH JULY 2025 (SALE NO.28)
There was good general demand for the 219,940 packages (14,833,441.00 kilo) available in the market; 46.27% was unsold.
MARKETS
Pakistan Packers and Bazaar were strong with Yemen and other Middle Eastern countries active. Kazakhstan and other CIS states lent more and useful support with Afghanistan more active; Egyptian Packers maintained participation. UK were active with improved interest from Russia. Sudan remained absent while South Sudan showed some enquiry. Local Packers were quiet while Somalia were more active at the lower end of the market.
OFFERINGS
Leaf Grades                    -    123,040 packages (8,078,671.00 kilos) - 51.66% unsold.
Dust Grades                  -     75,960 packages (5,670,070.00 kilos) - 46.34% unsold.
Secondary Grades          -     20,580 packages (1,066,700.00 kilos) - 13.80% unsold.
LEAF GRADES (M2 & M3)
BP1:
Best - Were irregular and varied between steady to USC56 dearer but some lines lost up to USC26.
Brighter - Were irregular and ranged between firm to USC23 above last levels to easier by up to USC14.
Mediums - KTDA mediums held value with some teas gaining by USC4. Plantation mediums appreciated by up to USC15 where sold.
Lower Medium - Met improved enquiry and advanced by up to USC32.
Plainer - Gained by up to USC12.
PF1:
Best - Appreciated by up to USC28.
Brighter - Gained up to USC14 but select invoices lost up to USC3.
Mediums - KTDA mediums were steady to USC14 dearer to easier by up to USC7 with plantation mediums irregular and ranged between USC2 above last levels to mostly easier by up to USC7.
Lower Medium - Saw improved absorption and varied between mostly dearer by up to USC14 but some lines shed up to USC4.
Plainer - Saw irregular enquiry ranging between firm to USC15 above previous levels  to easier by up to USC7.

In the Secondary Catalogues, BPs were firm to USC17 dearer for some best categories with better sorted PFs mostly selling above previous levels while others were steady. BANGLADESH AUCTION
SALE OF - 14TH JULY 2025 (SALE NO. 10)
CTC LEAF: 51,588 packages of tea on offer met with an improved demand.
BROKENS: Well made good liquoring Brokens were in strong demand and were dearer upto Tk.5/- and occasionally more. Medium varieties were also a good market and were mostly firm to slightly dearer. Plainer sorts met with a fair demand at around last levels with some withdrawals. BLF teas once again sold well at firm to slightly dearer rates. These realised prices between Tk. 170/- and Tk.233/.
FANNINGS : Well made good liquoring Fannings were a strong market and were firm to dearer following competition. Good Medium teas were also a good market and sold at firm to slightly dearer rates. Plainer sorts met with a fair demand at around last levels with some withdrawals. BLF teas once again sold well at firm to slightly dearer rates. These realised prices between Tk. 170/- and Tk.233/.
DUST: 12,748 packages of tea on offer met with a fairly good demand. Well made good liquoring Dusts had fairly good demand and sold well. Others again were an easier market and sold at a drop of Tk.5/- to Tk.8/- with some withdrawals. BLF Dusts again met with good demand and had only few withdrawals. Blenders lent strong support with fair interest from the Loose tea buyers.
COMMENTS: There was widespread demand this week generally noticeable for improved liquoring varieties which were often dearer. Blenders lent more support with Loose tea buyers operating in greater strength particularly for the well made sorts.
CDs were lower in demand and prices dropped substantially.
Our Catalogue: (Sale 10) Avg : Tk 246.33, Sold 70.86% , (Sale 9) Avg : Tk 242.08, Sold 78.25%

KOLKATA SALE  CTC MARKET
MARKET REPORT:
Top liquoring sorts around last levels. Medium and and plainer category tending easier and
seeing some withdrawals. Plainer Dooars seen so far tending lower and seeing withdrawals.
BUYING PATTERN:
Western India: Good support on the better teas
HUL : Quiet so far
West Bengal Manufacturing: Selective
Exporters: Fair enquiry
Other Internal/Local: Operating
KOLKATA SALE  ORTHODOX MARKET
MARKET REPORT:
Market opened to strong demand. Few tippy teas on offer selling readily. Well made Whole
Leaf and Brokens firm around last. Remainder Whole leaf and Brokens irregular around last.
Fannings and Cleaner Secondaries following selling at firm rates.
BUYING PATTERN:
Middle East : Active
CIS:  Good Support

BUYING PATTERN:
HUL: Mainstay
Western India: Good Support
West Bengal Manufacturing: Selective
Courtesy - J Thomas & Company
JAKARTA AUCTION
SALE OF - 11TH JULY (SALE NO.28)
CTC LEAF
The total CTC leaf teas sold this week was 69.78%(1,372,660.95kgs) of the total offering of 196,7213.73Kgs
DEMAND: - Good demand for best & good teas, fair demand on the better medium & medium sorts, however the lower medium and plainer teas saw resistance.
MARKET: - Best and good teas were irregular following quality with improved lines fetching handsome gains. Lower end of the good teas too gained some dearer prices. Better medium sold at barely steady to easier prices, medium teas shed about Rs 2 to 3 lower compared to last. The lower medium and plainer teas lost about Rs 3 to 5 with larger percentage of teas in this segment facing withdrawals.
BUYING PATTERN: - Major blenders and the western India packateer continued to be the pillar's of the market with fair support from exporters. Regional and some local buyers were active on the best and good liquoring sorts. Internal buyers continued to be subdued. The major blenders off-take was 56.05% of the total CTC leaf sold.
ORTHODOX LEAF
Demand:- Good Demand.
Market:- Whole leaf in both High and medium grown sold firm. Broken & fanning sold barely steady to easier.
Buying Pattern:- Russian and CIS buyers continued to be fairly active along with Internal buyers.Middle east shippers lent good support on whole leaf grades and broken.
CTC DUST
DEMAND: - Good for the best & good teas, fair for the better medium but less demand for the remainders.
MARKET: - CTC dust offer this week was at 526,876.30Kgs of which 402,435.05kgs were sold (76.38%). Best & good teas continued to sell firm to dearer prices with select few invoices fetching handsome gains. Good teas were steady, Better medium teas sold easier on quality except for the finer dust which sold barely steady. Others eased by Rs 2 to 5 with bulk of the lower medium and plainer teas remaining unsold.
BUYING PATTERN: - Major blenders were very choosy. Regional and local packeteers were active on the best & good teas. Up country buyers were subdued. Exporters to Russia, Middle east were selective this week on blacker sorts.
ORTHODOX DUST
DEMAND: - Strong demand on select primary but selective on the Medium grown & secondaries.
MARKET: - Select primary dust fetched handsome gains however the lower end of the high grown and the medium grown sold irregularly easier. Secondaries sold barely steady to easier.
BUYING PATTERN: -Regional & local packateers were active on primary dusts. Exporters were selective at steady prices on the secondary dusts.
Courtesy- J.Thomas & Co. Pvt. Ltd
